commentary: Kulasekara to Sehwag, OUT big shout for lbw and given by Kumar Dharmasena! It's a huge inswinger from outside off, and although it has caught Sehwag on the back foot, it seems to be sliding down the leg side. Dharmasena takes his time and raises the finger. Sehwag is not happy, but the tracker serive shows the ball would have kissed the outside of the leg stump

commentary: Kulasekara to Karthik, OUT Kula strikes again. Good planning, good catch, or is it a catch? Sanga has been standing up to stop Karthik from walking down and negating the swing. And after pinning him in the crease, Kula has been slipping in the straighter ones to beat him outside off. This time it is very close to off, and Sanga and Kula go for a big shout right away. There is no sound as the ball passes the bat, though. Nothing on the snicko either
text: Kula strikes again. Good planning, good catch, or is it a catch? Sanga has been standing up to stop Karthik from walking down and negating the swing. And after pinning him in the crease, Kula has been slipping in the straighter ones to beat him outside off. This time it is very close to off, and Sanga and Kula go for a big shout right away. There is no sound as the ball passes the bat, though. Nothing on the snicko either

commentary: Mathews to RG Sharma, OUT this is so plumb Mathews doesn't even appeal! Outswinger followed by inswinger, and gone! Simple as that. This time he plays around it without any feet movement, and it hits him in front of middle. Mathews knows he is gone and turns around to appeal only after he has crossed the batsman. Don't see anything wrong with it - it was so straight. Sharma again doesn't look happy and slowly trudges off, that's becoming a bit of a habit for him. Needs to watch it - last time he got away perhaps because Randiv's act hogged the headlines. Sharma's reaction then was clear dissent, and not the first instance in his career either
text: this is so plumb Mathews doesn't even appeal! Outswinger followed by inswinger, and gone! Simple as that. This time he plays around it without any feet movement, and it hits him in front of middle. Mathews knows he is gone and turns around to appeal only after he has crossed the batsman. Don't see anything wrong with it - it was so straight. Sharma again doesn't look happy and slowly trudges off, that's becoming a bit of a habit for him. Needs to watch it - last time he got away perhaps because Randiv's act hogged the headlines. Sharma's reaction then was clear dissent, and not the first instance in his career either

commentary: Mathews to Raina, no run huge shout, but not given!. Sangakkara, Dilshan, Jayawardene and Mathews can't believe it. It's a long, long appeal. Russel Arnold calls it 'very similar to the Hakka'. But facts first, slightly slower ball outside off, Raina hangs his bat out, and there is a sound and slight deviation - ever so slight - as it passes his bat. So Raina perhaps lucky to get away with it. Umpire Rauf is unmoved despite that appeal

So Raina perhaps lucky to get away with it. Umpire Rauf is unmoved despite that appeal

commentary: Perera to Dhoni, OUT no need for an umpire here! not the smartest shot Dhoni has played either. Sanga goes back to standing back, and immediately Dhoni goes for a walk down the pitch, and looks to turn this to leg from way outside off. the ball holds its line enough to get the edge, and Sanga holds it safely. Dhoni walks

commentary: Perera to Kumar, OUT and PK is gone first ball! Caught at mid-off! Perera on a hat-trick. PK looks at the pitch, then the bat. It was an extravagant drive on a back-of-a-length ball outside off. Nowhere near it. Ordinary shot, good, old tailender shot

commentary: Nehra to Dilshan, FOUR runs smashed away for four more! Short into the body, and he swivels and pulls this mercilessly to square-leg fence
text: smashed away for four more! Short into the body, and he swivels and pulls this mercilessly to square-leg fence

commentary: Nehra to Dilshan, no run flicked to short midwicket

commentary: Kumar to Jayawardene, FOUR runs and what a beautiful shot to start, leaning in, right on the top of it, and driving it through extra cover
text: and what a beautiful shot to start, leaning in, right on the top of it, and driving it through extra cover

commentary: Kumar to Jayawardene, FOUR runs bouncer, pulled away over midwicket for four, early night tonight

commentary: Kumar to Jayawardene, no run hit back to PK who gives Mahela a stare. Not required
text: hit back to PK who gives Mahela a stare. Not required

commentary: Kumar to Jayawardene, FOUR runs short again, and pulled to fine leg for four, fine of the long leg. Well done Mahela

commentary: I Sharma to Dilshan, FOUR runs and he is welcome to the crease with a crunchy shot from Dilshan, through covers for four
shortText: I Sharma to Dilshan, FOUR runs
text: and he is welcome to the crease with a crunchy shot from Dilshan, through covers for four

commentary: I Sharma to Dilshan, OUT Dilshan goes! He was in too much of a hurry to finish this asap. Looks to loft it straight down the ground, but it is not full enough and he ends up skying it to mid-off
text: Dilshan goes! He was in too much of a hurry to finish this asap. Looks to loft it straight down the ground, but it is not full enough and he ends up skying it to mid-off

commentary: I Sharma to Jayawardene, OUT Sharma on a hat-trick! Short ball, and pulled straight to midwicket. Sri Lankans want an early finish, but these wickets are delaying proceedings
text: Sharma on a hat-trick! Short ball, and pulled straight to midwicket. Sri Lankans want an early finish, but these wickets are delaying proceedings

commentary: I Sharma to Sangakkara, no run back of a length, Sanga gets back it to prevent what would have been the most incredible hat-trick ever - in terms of having zero effect on the way the match is headed
